metadata.title: CVE-2013-0198 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Dnsmasq before 2.66test2, when used with certain libvirt configurations,replies to queries from prohibited interfaces, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (traffic amplification) via spoofedTCP based DNS queries. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of anincomplete fix for CVE-2012-3411.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.65-1ubuntu1
dnsmasq-base - 2.65-1ubuntu1
dnsmasq-utils - 2.65-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.65-1ubuntu1').
